meanings.definition: Fall behind in movement, progress, or development.
meanings.sent1: The tired runner lagged behind the others during the race.
meanings.sent2: The student always lagged behind in completing his homework assignments.
meanings.sent3: The snail lagged behind the group, taking its time to reach the finish line.
meanings.sent4: The old car lagged behind, struggling to keep up with the faster vehicles on the highway.
meanings.sent5: As the hikers climbed the mountain, the inexperienced ones lagged behind, gasping for breath.

meanings.definition: A delay or interval between events or processes.
meanings.sent1: There was a lagged response from the audience after the comedian's joke.
meanings.sent2: The lagged delivery of the package caused inconvenience to the recipient.
meanings.sent3: The lagged arrival of the bus made the passengers anxious about reaching their destination on time.
meanings.sent4: The lagged start of the meeting led to a rushed discussion at the end.
meanings.sent5: The lagged loading of the webpage frustrated the user who was waiting to access the information.

meanings.definition: To cover or wrap with insulation material.
meanings.sent1: The workers lagged the pipes to prevent heat loss in the building.
meanings.sent2: It is important to lag the attic to keep the house warm during winter.
meanings.sent3: The handyman decided to lag the water heater to improve its energy efficiency.
meanings.sent4: The sailors lagged the ship's hull to protect it from the cold ocean water.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew will lag the walls to maintain the temperature inside the warehouse.
